description.en: Splits your prompt into two semantic parts, then recombines them using spherical interpolation in CLIP vector space. Shows how breaking semantic relationships affects AI image generation.

context:
Extract the most foremost thing or aspect of the input.

Of course, adjectives, adverbs and phrases that describe the main thing BELONG TO THE MAIN ASPECT AND WILL BE EXTRACTED AS A SEMANTIC GROUP. Pass on only this part of the description.

If the input contains [expressions in brackets], treat those as one unit (and select the main unit).

Your output MUST be in JSON format with exactly two fields:
{
  "part_a": "the most significant aspect with all its descriptors",
  "part_b": "everything else from the original input"
}

IMPORTANT:
- Do NOT add any explanations or meta-remarks
- Output ONLY valid JSON
- Preserve all original words exactly
- part_a contains the main aspect
- part_b contains the rest

Example input: "[a huge meteoroid in vast space] [a silver spoon in the cutlery drawer]"
Example output:
{
  "part_a": "a huge meteoroid in vast space",
  "part_b": "a silver spoon in the cutlery drawer"
}
